thread.title: Prop. C’s proposed lobbying crackdown irks nonprofits
thread.title_full: Prop. C’s proposed lobbying crackdown irks nonprofits - San Francisco Chronicle

author: John Wildermuth
title: Prop. C’s proposed lobbying crackdown irks nonprofits
text:
Photo: Michael Short, Special To The Chronicle While some nonprofits and grassroots groups have long backed efforts to battle a “pay-to-play” mentality at City Hall, they’re angry that Prop. C would treat them the same as the developers, landlords and commercial interests they often oppose. While some nonprofits and grassroots groups have long backed...
San Francisco’s Ethics Commission is going to the ballot to toughen the city’s rules on lobbyists, and some of their usual allies aren’t at all happy about it. While some nonprofits and grassroots groups have long backed efforts to battle a “pay-to-play” mentality at City Hall, they’re angry that Prop. C would treat them the same as the developers, landlords and commercial interests they often oppose. While some nonprofits and grassroots groups have long backed...
